articles.headline: Khamenei Killed in US-Israel Airstrike; Iran Vows Revenge
articles.summary: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed during a massive US-Israeli military operation targeting 24 provinces. Iran responded with missile strikes against Israel and US bases, while global markets braced for regional instability.

articles.headline: Afghan and Pakistani Forces Clash Overnight Along Disputed Border
articles.summary: Heavy fighting and drone strikes were reported near the Bagram air base and border provinces, causing civilian casualties. The escalation follows an offensive by Afghanistan in response to earlier Pakistani airstrikes on militant groups.

articles.headline: Khamenei dead as Iran strikes widen war in West Asia
articles.summary: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei was killed in joint US and Israeli air strikes on Tehran. In retaliation, Iran launched missile attacks against US military bases and oil tankers in the Gulf, causing global economic uncertainty.

articles.headline: Trump confirms US military is sinking the Iranian Navy
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump claimed that nine Iranian warships have been destroyed so far as the Pentagon intensifies its bombing campaign. He stated that stealth bombers are targeting hardened underground missile facilities across Iran.

articles.headline: Ten people die in Karachi while storming US consulate
articles.summary: Violent clashes broke out in Pakistan as pro-Iran demonstrators attempted to breach the US consulate in Karachi. Security forces used tear gas and batons to disperse the crowds, resulting in multiple deaths and dozens of injuries.

articles.headline: Iran vows revenge after killing of Supreme Leader Khamenei
articles.summary: Iran has promised devastating retaliation following the assassination of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in a US-Israeli strike. A leadership council has been established to choose a new supreme leader while regional instability intensifies.

articles.headline: OPEC+ agrees to modest oil output boost for April
articles.summary: OPEC+ members have agreed to increase oil production by 206,000 barrels per day despite the ongoing regional war. Analysts note that the group has limited spare capacity to add supply, except for Saudi Arabia and the UAE.

articles.headline: Turks increase gold holdings as prices hit record highs
articles.summary: The value of Turkey’s private gold stock has reached $750 billion, equivalent to nearly half the country's GDP. High domestic demand for gold as a hedge against inflation is reportedly slowing the central bank’s disinflation efforts.

articles.headline: US-Israel strikes kill Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
articles.summary: A joint US-Israeli military operation targeted and killed Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei in Tehran. Following the strike, Iran launched retaliatory drone and missile attacks on US Gulf allies, while Donald Trump signaled potential talks with the new leadership.

articles.headline: Iranian drones and missiles target US Gulf allies in Dubai and Abu Dhabi
articles.summary: Iran launched over 200 drones and 137 ballistic missiles at the UAE, Oman, and other US allies in the Gulf. The attacks damaged Dubai International Airport and set fire to the Burj Al Arab hotel, causing multiple injuries.

articles.headline: Protests erupt in Pakistan and Kashmir over killing of Ayatollah Khamenei
articles.summary: Violent demonstrations broke out in Pakistan, leading to the deaths of 12 protesters during clashes near the US consulate in Karachi. Protests and mourning ceremonies were also reported in Srinagar, Delhi, and Baghdad following the strike on Iran.

articles.headline: Product tanker hit by projectile off Oman coast killing one crew member
articles.summary: The Marshall Islands-flagged tanker MKD VYOM was struck by a projectile off the coast of Oman, resulting in one fatality. A second tanker, the Skylight, carrying 15 Indian nationals, also came under attack near the Strait of Hormuz.

articles.headline: Oil tanker with fifteen Indian crew members attacked near Oman coast
articles.summary: The Palau-flagged oil tanker Skylight was targeted near the Strait of Hormuz, leaving four crew members injured. The ship, which was reportedly carrying 15 Indian nationals, was evacuated as regional maritime security remains at high risk.

articles.headline: Iran hits Israel, U.S. bases after killing of Khamenei
articles.summary: Iran launched missile and drone strikes against Israel and U.S. bases following the assassination of Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Over 200 people were reportedly killed in the initial U.S. and Israeli bombardment of Tehran and government facilities.

articles.headline: Editorial: Imperial war and the collapse of international law
articles.summary: The Hindu editorializes that the U.S.-Israeli strikes on Iran constitute a reckless escalation and a violation of sovereign boundaries. The piece warns that the assassination of a head of state shreds the rules-based global order.

articles.headline: Hezbollah vows to confront U.S. and Israel over Iran strikes
articles.summary: Lebanese group Hezbollah has pledged to retaliate against the alliance following the killing of its key backer, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Leader Naim Qassem stated the movement would not abandon the 'field of resistance'.

articles.headline: Putin calls Khamenei's killing a cynical violation of morality
articles.summary: The Russian President slammed the U.S.-Israeli military operation, calling it a breach of international law. Russia has called for an immediate de-escalation and a return to diplomatic processes in West Asia.

articles.headline: At least 22 killed in violent pro-Iran protests across Pakistan
articles.summary: Clashes between security forces and pro-Iran demonstrators in Karachi and Gilgit-Baltistan left 22 dead and 120 injured. Protesters targeted the U.S. Consulate and UN offices following the escalation in West Asia.

articles.headline: Strait of Hormuz Closure Forces Indian Refiners to Seek New Sources
articles.summary: India's petroleum ministry is scouting for alternative oil supplies in Africa and South America following Iran's closure of the Strait of Hormuz. Nearly half of India's crude imports and 54% of its LNG routed through this vital chokepoint.

articles.headline: Net GST Revenue Rises 8% to ₹1.6 Trillion in February
articles.summary: Central and state governments collected ₹1.61 trillion in GST during February after adjusting for refunds, marking a 7.9% year-on-year growth. Gross collections before refunds stood at ₹1.84 trillion, reflecting resilient domestic consumption.

articles.headline: India-EU Free Trade Draft Clarifies Origin Rules for Textiles
articles.summary: New provisions under the proposed trade pact specify separate tolerance rules for non-originating textile materials to help Indian exporters. The move aims to provide clarity on preferential tariff benefits for the labor-intensive sector.

articles.headline: Gas Markets Face Most Significant Turmoil Since Russia-Ukraine War
articles.summary: The suspension of LNG tankers through the Strait of Hormuz has triggered price volatility for major Asian importers like India and China. Traders are checking for alternative cargoes as nearly 20% of global gas supply is at risk.

articles.headline: Sebi Unveils Life Cycle Mutual Funds for Goal-Based Investing
articles.summary: The new fund category will automatically shift asset allocation from equity to debt as investors approach target dates like retirement. These open-ended schemes will feature fixed maturities and higher exit loads to encourage financial discipline.

articles.headline: India returns to global trade game with renewed deal activism
articles.summary: Veteran US trade negotiators note that India is reviving stalled talks and expanding its trade framework beyond traditional skepticism. New Delhi is increasingly focused on advanced Western economies as key growth markets for bilateral agreements.

articles.headline: Oil lines blocked as India explores African and South American sources
articles.summary: The closure of the Strait of Hormuz has forced Indian refiners to seek alternative crude oil suppliers outside West Asia. Currently, nearly half of India's crude imports and 54 percent of its LNG are routed through the now-blocked waterway.

articles.headline: West Asia exports face fresh headwinds amid Iran war
articles.summary: India's $10 billion IT exports and outbound trade to the Gulf region are at risk due to the intensifying Iran-Israel conflict. Exporters fear higher freight costs and significant transit delays for shipments moving through the Strait of Hormuz.

articles.headline: Iran war raises fears of oil supply and price shock
articles.summary: The killing of Iran’s Supreme Leader has triggered concerns regarding India’s oil supply security and a rising import bill. Government officials are weighing alternative procurement options, including Russian crude, to mitigate potential logistics and war premium costs.

articles.headline: GST collection in February up 8 per cent to mark growth
articles.summary: Goods and Services Tax collections rose over 8 per cent in February, reaching ₹1.25 lakh crore from domestic consumption. Experts suggest the growth is broad-based and signifies sustained economic resilience across various states.

articles.headline: Iran-Israel crisis likely to rattle Indian markets and gold prices
articles.summary: Financial analysts expect the Nifty 50 to open with a wide gap-down below 25,000 following US-Israeli strikes on Iran. Conversely, gold prices are expected to surge toward $6,000 per ounce as investors seek safe-haven assets.

articles.headline: Miscellaneous capital receipts exceed revised estimates at 34,000 crore
articles.summary: Assisted by asset monetisation, miscellaneous capital receipts have surpassed the government's revised estimates for the current fiscal. For the next fiscal year, the budget target for these receipts has been set at ₹80,000 crore.

articles.headline: IEA voices concern over rising household electricity bills globally
articles.summary: The International Energy Agency reported that electricity prices in advanced economies have risen faster than incomes since 2019. The report suggests that high taxes and fees are hindering household incentives to switch to electric cooking and heating.

articles.headline: Karnataka government likely to cut budget outlay amid revenue shortfall
articles.summary: The state government expects a shortfall in tax collections, potentially reducing the current fiscal budget from Rs 4.1 lakh crore to Rs 3.95 lakh crore. Officials are evaluating revenue mobilization measures before the upcoming 2026-27 budget announcement.

articles.headline: Dalal Street investors brace for market volatility amid West Asia conflict
articles.summary: The Sensex and Nifty are expected to open lower following military strikes in Iran and retaliatory attacks in the Gulf. Analysts predict a surge in crude oil and precious metal prices, putting pressure on the Indian rupee and balance of trade.

articles.headline: Indian government monitors oil prices and supply chains amid Gulf tension
articles.summary: Policymakers are tracking the surge in Brent crude prices, which hit $80 a barrel following attacks on Iran. While no immediate shortage is seen, the government may consider lowering domestic levies if retail pump margins are significantly impacted.

articles.headline: Shaktikanta Das describes India as pillar of stability amid global turmoil
articles.summary: Principal Secretary to the PM and former RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das stated that India will shape global growth over the next decade. He highlighted structural reforms and fiscal consolidation as key factors that will maintain India's position as the fastest-growing major economy.

articles.headline: Monthly GST collection rises to over ₹1.83 lakh crore
articles.summary: India's gross GST revenue grew by 8.1% in February, driven by higher growth in domestic sales and a 17.2% surge in import revenue. Total net collections after refunds stood at approximately ₹1.61 lakh crore.

articles.headline: Bharti Mittal Unveils Family Succession Plan for Next Generation
articles.summary: Bharti Enterprises founder Sunil Bharti Mittal announced that family members will gradually assume larger roles at the shareholders' table. His children and younger siblings are being mentored to manage independent business units within the group.

articles.headline: Cognizant Snaps Up $300 Million Daimler Deal From Infosys
articles.summary: Cognizant CEO Ravi Kumar successfully secured a multi-year workplace services deal with Daimler Trucks, a contract he previously managed at Infosys. The deal is valued at approximately $60 million annually and involves AI-driven workplace transformation.

articles.headline: SME Migration to Mainboard Slows Following Tougher Eligibility Rules
articles.summary: New National Stock Exchange rules requiring ₹100 crore revenue and higher market capitalization have slowed the graduation of small firms. Migration fell from 65 companies in 2021 to only three in 2025 due to heightened governance scrutiny.

articles.headline: Indian Banks Report 11,615 Fraud Cases Totalling ₹3,497 Crore
articles.summary: Public sector banks accounted for 70% of the total amount involved in bank frauds during the 2024-25 period. Loan-related fraud remains the largest category by value, while card and internet fraud dominate the number of incidents.

articles.headline: Government Eases Factory Inspection Norms Under New BIS Framework
articles.summary: A self-declaration route has been introduced for select electronics and IT products to eliminate mandatory pre-licence factory inspections. The move shifts the regulatory focus toward documentation scrutiny and post-market surveillance to support manufacturing.

articles.headline: Novo Holdings Scales Up Indian Healthcare Investments with Larger Deals
articles.summary: The Denmark-based investor is shifting focus toward mature assets in India, raising typical cheque sizes from $20 million to $100 million. About half of Novo's 18 Asian portfolio firms are now located in the Indian market.

articles.headline: Dorf Ketal Defers IPO to Fund $1.8 Billion Italmatch Acquisition
articles.summary: Chemicals manufacturer Dorf Ketal has paused its public listing to raise ₹2,000 crore in a pre-IPO round for acquiring Italmatch Chemicals. The company is currently in talks with global private equity firms to finance the specialty chemicals deal.

articles.headline: Rare Earth Giant Proterial Warns India Against Overcrowding Magnet Market
articles.summary: Japanese firm Proterial suggests New Delhi should be selective in backing manufacturers to ensure long-term economic viability. The company is evaluating a domestic plant for Neodymium Ferrite Boron magnets to reduce dependence on China.

articles.headline: Middle East Crisis Causes ₹500 Crore Revenue Hit for Indian Airlines
articles.summary: Air India and IndiGo cancelled approximately 850 flights over two days due to airspace restrictions following strikes in Iran. Longer flight routes and increased fuel costs are expected to strain the profits of major domestic carriers.

articles.headline: UAE Real Estate Market Faces Sentiment Volatility After Retaliatory Strikes
articles.summary: Property developers in Dubai and Ras Al Khaimah are monitoring the impact of regional conflict on global wealth migration and sales. While short-term caution is expected, consultants believe the UAE's long-term attractiveness for investors remains intact.

articles.headline: Omnicom FUSE Bets on Music and Cricket Synergy for Brand Growth
articles.summary: Sports marketing agency FUSE is pitching for long-term entertainment partnerships during major cricket tournaments like the IPL and World Cups. The strategy aims to replicate international models like the Super Bowl to attract global premium brands.

articles.headline: Amazon India Waives Seller Commissions for All Products Under ₹1,000
articles.summary: The e-commerce giant expanded its zero-commission policy to 12.5 crore products to attract more home-based and small-scale sellers. The initiative targets sub-₹1,000 daily consumption items across categories like fashion, toys, and electronics.

articles.headline: Ex-Bira Staff Protest Outside CEO Residence Over Unpaid Wages
articles.summary: Former employees of B9 Beverages staged a silent demonstration in New Delhi alleging months of delayed salaries and missing provident fund deposits. Protesters claim the lack of payment has disrupted loan repayments and household finances since their exit.

articles.headline: Leading Automakers Report Sustained Dispatch Growth in February
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, and Mahindra saw increased dealer dispatches last month driven by robust domestic demand for utility vehicles. Tata Motors recorded a notable 34% rise in passenger vehicle dispatches compared to the previous year.

articles.headline: Organized Villa Rental Market Triples in Value Since Pandemic
articles.summary: India's second-home market has grown to an estimated $3.2 billion as affluent buyers convert holiday homes into income-generating assets. Managed villa platforms now account for nearly 4% of supply, offering yields of up to 6%.

articles.headline: Parliamentary committee urges government to speed up India-EU trade deal
articles.summary: Lawmakers have pressed for the conclusion of the free trade agreement with the European Union to address bottlenecks in technology and student mobility. Concerns were also raised about the EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism affecting Indian exports.

articles.headline: Conflict threatens Indian basmati rice exports to West Asian markets
articles.summary: Rice exporters have been advised to avoid new credit commitments to Iran and Gulf destinations as shipping disruptions intensify. Nearly 80 percent of India's basmati exports go to five countries currently affected by the regional military conflict.

articles.headline: Passenger Vehicle dispatches up 1.5 per cent in February
articles.summary: India’s passenger vehicle wholesales grew to approximately 4.25 lakh units in February compared to last year. Major manufacturers including Tata Motors, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Toyota reported double-digit growth during the month.

articles.headline: SEBI chairman not in favour of imposing SME IPO restrictions
articles.summary: SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey stated that the regulator is focusing on tightening due diligence and monitoring rather than restricting the SME fundraising route. He emphasized that isolated cases of misuse should not negatively impact the entire segment.

articles.headline: Tata and global firms deepen Gujarat semiconductor manufacturing push
articles.summary: Tata Electronics and CG Semi are advancing their semiconductor projects in Dholera and Sanand, with commercial operations slated for later this year. Additional investments worth ₹1,600 crore from Japanese and Malaysian firms were also announced for the state.

articles.headline: SLMG Beverages opens 1,200 crore manufacturing unit in Bihar
articles.summary: SLMG Beverages inaugurated a major beverage manufacturing facility in Buxar, Bihar, representing a ₹1,200 crore investment. The plant features seven production lines and will serve as a primary supply hub for Eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

articles.headline: Eighteen Indian aircraft stranded overseas due to West Asia conflict
articles.summary: Eighteen Indian planes are stuck at various international airports due to sudden airspace closures in West Asia. Over two hundred crew members from IndiGo and Air India Express are safe but remaining in the region awaiting further instructions.

articles.headline: India Inc issues travel advisories to employees amid geopolitical tensions
articles.summary: Major corporations including TCS, L&T, and Deloitte have suspended non-essential travel to the Gulf region for their staff. Companies are coordinating with Indian embassies to track developments and ensure the safety of employees on the ground.

articles.headline: Zelestra Energy India rebrands to Resolven under new strategy
articles.summary: Spanish firm Zelestra has renamed its Indian arm Resolven as it targets a 10 GW renewable energy pipeline by 2030. The firm is backed by private equity firm EQT and currently manages 2.7 GW of projects.

articles.headline: Public sector banks outpace private peers in credit growth
articles.summary: Public sector banks recorded 14.1 per cent credit growth in December 2025, consistently outperforming private sector rivals. Improved asset quality and cleaner balance sheets have allowed State-owned lenders to aggressively expand in retail and MSME segments.

articles.headline: Maersk pauses all sailings through Suez and Hormuz straits
articles.summary: Global shipping giant Maersk has suspended all vessel crossings in the Strait of Hormuz and Suez Canal until further notice. Ships are being rerouted around Africa, which will lead to significant delays and schedule adjustments for Arabian Gulf ports.

articles.headline: Rice exporters warned to avoid CIF deals to Iran and Gulf
articles.summary: The Indian Rice Exporters Federation advised members to avoid cost, insurance, and freight (CIF) commitments due to escalating West Asian tensions. Sellers are encouraged to use free-on-board terms to shift freight and insurance risks to international buyers.

articles.headline: ICICI Prudential MF to stop fresh inflows in international funds
articles.summary: ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund will suspend fresh subscriptions in three international schemes starting Monday to comply with AMFI investment limits. The suspension applies to lump sums and new SIP registrations for US and Nasdaq-focused funds.

articles.headline: Real money gaming ban boosts investment in casual esports
articles.summary: India's ban on real-money gaming has redirected venture capital toward casual gaming and esports media. Investors are increasingly focusing on game engines, community platforms, and cross-border intellectual property exports.

articles.headline: Trilling Dollar Venture fund to deploy fifty crore for consumer startups
articles.summary: Early-stage investor TDV has launched a ₹50-crore second fund to target Indian consumer-focused startups. The fund focuses on wealth-tech, premium D2C brands, and AI-native platforms reimagining consumer services.

articles.headline: JSW Steel forfeits 127 crore deposit for missing iron ore targets
articles.summary: The Karnataka government encashed JSW Steel's performance security deposit after the company failed to meet production targets at its Chitradurga block. The Supreme Court declined to stay the action, noting a cumulative shortfall of 10.3 lakh tonnes of ore.

articles.headline: Adani Group confirms Haifa Port in Israel remains secure and operational
articles.summary: Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone stated that its employees and infrastructure at Haifa Port are safe despite regional conflict. The company is coordinating with Israel's Ministry of Transport to monitor safety instructions during the ongoing strikes.

articles.headline: Insurers likely to hike war risk premiums following Middle East conflict
articles.summary: Marine and aviation insurers are expected to invoke cancellation clauses and raise premiums for vessels transiting the Strait of Hormuz. The escalation has prompted fears of ship seizures and route diversions, significantly increasing trade insurance costs.

articles.headline: Indian automakers report double digit sales growth in February despite global risks
articles.summary: Major carmakers like Maruti Suzuki, Hyundai, and Tata Motors saw healthy sales growth, bolstered by stable domestic demand and exports. However, analysts warn that the West Asia conflict could pose risks to future production and supply chains.

articles.headline: SEBI to use AI for enhanced market surveillance
articles.summary: The market regulator is set to boost technological oversight and use artificial intelligence to identify market manipulators. SEBI Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey urged investors to use the 'SEBI Check' tool to verify registered intermediaries.

articles.headline: World Bank Links 14% of Global Agricultural Subsidies to Deforestation
articles.summary: The World Bank is pushing countries like India to rethink fertilizer subsidies that lead to soil degradation and environmental damage. Global agricultural support reaches $2 billion daily, but much of it is currently deemed nature-negative.

articles.headline: Helicopter survey for rare minerals sparks concern in Raichur
articles.summary: A low-altitude geophysical survey conducted by the Geological Survey Department has drawn attention in the 'Land of Gold.' Residents have expressed apprehension about the potential environmental impact of future mining activities in the forest area.

articles.headline: Wayanad landslide survivors move into new homes in township
articles.summary: The Kerala government handed over the first phase of 178 homes to families displaced by the 2024 Wayanad landslides. The new township includes solar plants, waste collection facilities, and community spaces designed under a 'build back better' principle.

articles.headline: Environmentalists warn US-Iran war will significantly increase global air pollution
articles.summary: The use of missiles and drones is releasing toxic metals and black carbon into the atmosphere, threatening regional health. Experts warn these pollutants can travel long distances, further accelerating the melting of glaciers and ice sheets.

articles.headline: Solar power projects under construction hit 100 GW milestone
articles.summary: India's large-scale solar projects under construction reached 100.65 GW at the end of December 2025. Rajasthan and Gujarat house the majority of these upcoming installations, followed by Karnataka and Madhya Pradesh.

articles.headline: Animal rights activists report widespread cruelty and violations in Bengaluru pet shops
articles.summary: A report submitted to the Greater Bengaluru Authority documented cramped enclosures, lack of hygiene, and the illegal sale of protected wildlife. Activists found that 90% of pet shops in the city operate without proper registration or certificates.

articles.headline: Mega cleanliness drive in Bengaluru North clears thirty-five tonnes of waste
articles.summary: Over 1,800 participants and residents' welfare associations joined a plogging drive organized by the Bengaluru North City Corporation. The campaign successfully cleaned 81 vacant sites across seven divisions in a single day.

articles.headline: Wild elephant kills nineteen year old student in Madikeri forest region
articles.summary: A teenager returning home for her holidays was attacked and killed by a wild elephant in Bettathur. The victim's mother had a narrow escape when the elephant appeared suddenly as they were walking home from a motorcycle drop-off.

articles.headline: Tree ring study reveals 2022 was driest spring in Himalayas in four centuries
articles.summary: Scientists analyzing deodar tree rings in Himachal Pradesh found that spring precipitation has reached its lowest level in nearly 400 years. The study warns that sustained droughts threaten water security for millions who rely on Himalayan-fed rivers.

articles.headline: M.P. CM releases gharials into Kuno National Park river
articles.summary: Chief Minister Mohan Yadav released 53 gharials and 25 turtles into the Kuno River as part of a major conservation effort. The project is led by the National Chambal Sanctuary to restore riverine biodiversity.

articles.headline: Climate resilience critical for future coconut cultivation, says study
articles.summary: Experts argue that India's coconut promotion schemes must shift focus from productivity to climate-resilience and sustainability. Research indicates that rising temperatures could significantly impact traditional plantations along the east coast by 2050.

articles.headline: National Health Authority Launches Free Digital Platform for Clinics
articles.summary: The new eSushrut@Clinic platform provides a low-cost management tool for small medical facilities to digitize records and treatment planning. The initiative mirrors the BHIM UPI model to integrate 70,000 hospitals into the national digital health ecosystem.

articles.headline: OpenAI Reaches Pentagon Agreement Following Anthropic Supply Chain Dispute
articles.summary: Sam Altman confirmed that OpenAI will deploy AI models in the US defense department's classified networks with specific safety guardrails. The move follows the Pentagon's decision to label rival Anthropic a supply-chain risk over surveillance concerns.

articles.headline: Nvidia Partners With Telecom Firms to Build AI-Ready 6G Networks
articles.summary: Nvidia is teaming up with Nokia, SoftBank, and T-Mobile to develop sixth-generation networks capable of supporting advanced AI services. The current 5G infrastructure is deemed insufficient for the widespread use of future autonomous AI devices.

articles.headline: Centre's new chips push to focus on deep-tech design facilities
articles.summary: Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced that Semicon Mission 2.0 will prioritize bolstering startups involved in semiconductor design. The government aims to foster the creation of domestic tech giants similar to Qualcomm or Nvidia.

articles.headline: Priyank Kharge outlines vision for AI-driven creative economy at GAFX
articles.summary: Karnataka plans to establish a Responsible Use of AI framework to support the animation and gaming sectors. Minister Kharge emphasized focusing on intellectual property creation and large-scale skilling to boost digital exports.

articles.headline: Airtel and Google partner to reduce mobile spam in India
articles.summary: Bharti Airtel and Google have collaborated to integrate network intelligence with RCS messaging to filter spam for millions of users. The partnership aims to provide a secure and high-quality messaging experience including photo and video support.

articles.headline: Premier Energies unveils India’s first zero busbar solar cell
articles.summary: Premier Energies has introduced a structural shift in solar technology with zero busbar (0BB) TOPCon cells. This innovation replaces thick silver strips with fine lines, potentially reducing silver consumption costs by ₹7.5 lakh per MW.

articles.headline: Indian IT faces fresh headwinds as Gulf war risks mount
articles.summary: India's $10 billion IT export market in West Asia faces disruption as clients may deprioritize digital transformation projects. Analysts warn that rising oil prices and regional instability could hurt growth for Indian firms in the energy and BFSI sectors.

articles.headline: Rise of physical AI integrates intelligence with real-world action
articles.summary: A new category called Physical AI is embedding autonomous intelligence into robots and industrial systems for real-world tasks. Companies like Perceptyne and Netradyne are developing millisecond-level reasoning for manufacturing safety and logistics.

articles.headline: Kolkata startup Mihup upgrades inclusive voice tech with GenAI
articles.summary: Conversational AI platform Mihup is integrating Generative AI into its voice assistants for automotive and call center applications. The technology supports multilingual commands and automated quality audits, helping to reduce driver distraction and improve enterprise efficiency.

articles.headline: Karnataka nears completion of digitizing seventy-one crore land record pages
articles.summary: The Revenue Department's Bhu Suraksha project has archived 71 crore pages of land documents across 102 taluk offices. The initiative allows citizens to download certified copies online, reducing corruption and the need to visit government offices.

articles.headline: Russian and Chinese air defence systems in Iran fail against US-Israel strikes
articles.summary: Iran's air defence network, including the Russian S-300 and Chinese HQ-9B, reportedly failed to intercept advanced stealth fighter jets during recent strikes. Analysts suggest the systems were neutralized by sophisticated electronic warfare and suppression techniques.

articles.headline: Major Indian IT firms suspend West Asia travel amid security crisis
articles.summary: Infosys, TCS, and Wipro have issued advisories to employees, discouraging non-essential travel to the Gulf region. Companies have activated crisis-response teams to track associates in impacted areas and monitor for potential cyber threats.

articles.headline: Karnataka IT Minister says AI could slash animation production costs by forty percent
articles.summary: Minister Priyank Kharge highlighted how AI-powered tools are streamlining creative pipelines and accelerating turnaround times in the animation sector. While the technology boosts productivity, he cautioned about the need to address job displacement and ethical risks.

articles.headline: Explainer: How missile interceptors function in the U.S.-Iran war
articles.summary: A technical look at the regional air defense network, including the Iron Dome, Patriot, and UAE's Cheongung II systems. The report examines how saturation attacks and production limits affect the efficacy of these billion-dollar defense shields.

articles.headline: NCLAT Dismisses Dhoot Petitions Against Initiation of Personal Insolvency
articles.summary: The appellate tribunal upheld insolvency proceedings against Rajkumar and Pradeep Dhoot following a ₹5,353 crore default by Videocon Industries. The brothers had challenged the NCLT's earlier orders regarding their status as personal guarantors.

articles.headline: Man kills debtor and stages own death to evade trial
articles.summary: Police in Saharanpur arrested a man who murdered his debtor and burned the body inside a car to fake his own demise. The accused intended to evade a possible conviction in a pending rape trial.

articles.headline: Adani Power wins case over disputed energy charges in Karnataka
articles.summary: The CERC has ruled in favor of Adani Power, ordering Karnataka discoms to pay ₹67.11 crore in energy charges. The dispute involved fuel cost increases from coal supplier Glencore that state utilities had previously withheld.

articles.headline: Industry seeks government intervention in Fino Payments Bank arrest
articles.summary: Industry bodies have requested the Union government's intervention following the arrest of Fino Payments Bank MD Rishi Gupta. The Payments Council of India expressed concerns over governance continuity and proportionality in the GST investigation.

articles.headline: Senior transport inspector booked for issuing ten thousand fake fitness certificates
articles.summary: An FIR was registered against Nisar Ahmed of Bangalore Central RTO for issuing fitness certificates without physical vehicle inspections. Authorities discovered the fraud after Gujarat transport officials noted that the vehicles never entered Karnataka during the processing dates.

articles.headline: Bengaluru police arrest three more suspects in Jakkur villa gangrape case
articles.summary: Three additional individuals were arrested for supporting the alleged gangrape of a 19-year-old student at a villa in Jakkur. The arrests include the person who assisted in booking the property, bringing the total number of detainees to five.

articles.headline: Karnataka High Court rules motor accident tribunals can hear personal insurance claims
articles.summary: The High Court held that Motor Accident Claims Tribunals have the jurisdiction to examine personal accident cover claims under motor insurance policies. The ruling came after an insurance company challenged the tribunal's power to adjudicate private contract matters.

articles.headline: Bengaluru East police recover stolen mobile phones worth 1.6 crore rupees
articles.summary: Using the Central Equipment Identity Register, police traced and recovered 641 stolen mobile phones over two months. The devices were returned to their rightful owners during a public grievance meeting led by the police commissioner.

articles.headline: Mathura police book nine social media users for defaming Lathmar Holi
articles.summary: An FIR was registered against nine people for allegedly circulating edited and defamatory clips of the 5,000-year-old Lathmar Holi tradition. Police found that influencers used old footage to misrepresent the religious celebrations of Barsana and Nandgaon.

articles.headline: Eighty-three girls moved from Trichy home following physical abuse allegations
articles.summary: Government officials transferred 83 children from Annai Ashram to other facilities after reports of verbal and physical abuse by caretakers. The district administration has suspended subsidies for the home pending a full inquiry into negligence and medical care.

articles.headline: Mandoli jail inmate dies five days after alleged assault by fellow prisoners
articles.summary: A 35-year-old undertrial, Mohammad Azad, died in a Delhi hospital following a brawl inside Mandoli prison. His family has alleged that he was beaten by both inmates and jail personnel, prompting a police inquiry into the death.

articles.headline: Court acquits five men accused of dacoity conspiracy after eighteen years
articles.summary: A Vadodara court acquitted five men arrested in 2008 for allegedly planning a robbery, citing lack of evidence. The judge ruled that the mere presence of the accused with weapons does not prove a specific plan to commit dacoity.

articles.headline: JNU students released from jail following city court order
articles.summary: Thirteen students arrested during a campus protest walked out of jail after a Delhi court ordered their prompt release. The court ruled that administrative delays in bond verification should not violate the right to personal liberty.

articles.headline: Delhi Police retains top rank in national CCTNS execution
articles.summary: Delhi Police achieved a 100% score for the fourth consecutive month in implementing the Crime and Criminal Tracking Network & Systems. The ranking evaluates states on the quality and timeliness of criminal data digitization.

articles.headline: CJI emphasizes building public trust through judicial security
articles.summary: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant stated that court complexes should function with the efficiency of hospitals to ensure prompt justice. He made the remarks while laying the foundation for a new court complex in Tirupati.

articles.headline: VOC Port to Invest ₹15,000 Crore in Ambition Outer Harbour Project
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu's VOC Port Authority plans a major expansion to increase cargo-handling capacity and serve as a regional transhipment hub. The investment includes ₹1,500 crore for infrastructure upgrades and new-age clean energy technologies.

articles.headline: Construction of two new units begins at Kaiga nuclear plant
articles.summary: NPCIL has commenced the first pour of concrete for units five and six at the Kaiga nuclear power plant in Karnataka. The expansion will add 1,400 MW of capacity using pressurized heavy water reactors to help meet India's net-zero goals.

articles.headline: CJI lays foundation stone for new court complex in Tirupati
articles.summary: Chief Justice of India Justice Surya Kant laid the foundation for a proposed 16-building court complex in Tirupati. The event was attended by several Supreme Court and High Court judges, following a guard of honor from the state police.

articles.headline: Vaishnaw announces three more chip plants operational by end of 2026
articles.summary: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated that four out of ten approved semiconductor plants will be in commercial production this year. The government is shifting focus toward creating a domestic design ecosystem for deep-tech startups.

articles.headline: Centre mulls 30,000 crore modified UDAN scheme for April takeoff
articles.summary: The Union Cabinet is expected to review a revamped regional air connectivity scheme with a total outlay of ₹30,000 crore. The plan aims to connect 120 additional destinations and support four crore passengers over the next decade.

articles.headline: Mass flight cancellations across West Asia strand thousands of Indian travelers
articles.summary: Airspace closures following the Iran-Israel conflict led to the cancellation of approximately 2,000 flights by Indian and West Asian carriers. Thousands of Indian tourists and expatriates are currently stranded at major transit hubs like Dubai and Doha.

articles.headline: Mahadevapura zone to get fifty kilometers of safe pedestrian pathways
articles.summary: GBA Chief Commissioner Maheshwar Rao has directed officials to develop 50km of accessible footpaths within two months. The project will prioritize stretches along Metro corridors and involves repairing slabs and clearing unauthorized parking.

articles.headline: Statewide audit finds infrastructure in Karnataka largely inaccessible for disabled persons
articles.summary: A comprehensive accessibility audit covering 1.8 lakh locations in Karnataka revealed that most ramps, toilets, and tactile paths remain unusable. The report highlights significant design flaws and a lack of functional features in public transport and buildings.

articles.headline: Global air travel crippled as nearly two thousand flights are cancelled
articles.summary: West Asian airlines like Emirates and Qatar Airways cancelled 1,600 flights, while Indian carriers cancelled 350 services due to airspace closures. Air India has rerouted North American flights with technical stops in Rome to avoid the conflict zone.

articles.headline: Villagers in Pilibhit peel off new road surface with bare hands
articles.summary: Residents of Bidhipur village demonstrated substandard construction by lifting the top layer of a newly built Rs 80 lakh road. The District Magistrate has ordered a technical verification and warned of action against the contractor and PWD engineers.

articles.headline: PM Modi unveils infrastructure projects worth ₹4,400 crore
articles.summary: In Madurai, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated and laid foundations for major highway and development projects. He emphasized that the collective goal is to transform connectivity to build a developed India.

articles.headline: Varanasi temple road widening project sparks local displacement fears
articles.summary: A major project to ease pilgrim access to Kashi Vishwanath Temple has left hundreds of shopkeepers in Dal Mandi facing eviction. Over 180 buildings have been marked for demolition, raising disputes over circle rates and compensation.

articles.headline: India Innovation Gap Widens as Corporate R&D Expenditure Remains Low
articles.summary: India's R&D spending stands at just 0.6% of GDP, with the private sector contributing only 36% compared to 75% in peer economies. Industrial research is heavily concentrated in pharmaceuticals and automobiles, with a lack of investment in frontier tech.

articles.headline: Karnataka government weighs ban on mobile phones for under-16s
articles.summary: Officials are debating a proposal to prohibit mobile phone use for children under 16 to address device dependency and cyberbullying. Parents and experts remain divided, citing concerns over safety tracking and the difficulty of enforcing age verification.

articles.headline: AI can democratise basic research says ANRF CEO
articles.summary: Shivkumar Kalyanaraman, CEO of the Anusandhan National Research Foundation, highlighted AI's ability to accelerate knowledge exploration and simulation models. He delivered the National Science Day address, stressing the benefits for the research community.

articles.headline: Gujarat unveils Science Technology and Innovation Policy 2026-31
articles.summary: The Gujarat government has launched a new STI policy featuring a ₹1,000-crore dedicated innovation fund. The policy targets the creation of one lakh skilled research professionals and focuses on AI, semiconductors, and quantum technologies.

articles.headline: New study suggests the human chin evolved as an accidental byproduct
articles.summary: Research published in PLOS One argues that the human chin has no specific evolutionary purpose and formed as an incidental feature. The study suggests the chin is a "spandrel" that appeared as heads became larger and teeth became smaller over time.

articles.headline: Science Explainer: How astronauts survive extreme atmospheric re-entry
articles.summary: The article explains blunt body theory and thermal protection systems used to dissipate 98% of kinetic energy as heat. It also details the three-stage redundant parachute system planned for India's Gaganyaan crew module.

articles.headline: PM Modi speaks to UAE president and condemns West Asia attacks
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed solidarity with UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed following Iranian missile strikes on the Emirates. Modi called for de-escalation and regional peace while thanking the UAE for protecting the Indian community.

articles.headline: Cabinet Committee on Security reviews fallout of West Asia conflict
articles.summary: PM Modi chaired a high-level meeting of the CCS to assess the impact of the Iran-Israel escalation on India's energy security. The committee specifically reviewed the closure of the Strait of Hormuz and the safety of nine million Indians in the region.

articles.headline: PM Modi targets DMK government over corruption in Madurai rally
articles.summary: In poll-bound Tamil Nadu, Prime Minister Modi criticized the Stalin-led government for dynasty politics and alleged insensitivity toward religious sentiments. He also inaugurated infrastructure projects worth over ₹4,400 crore during his visit to the state.

articles.headline: Special Intensive Revision causes drop in voter numbers across India
articles.summary: The ECI's voter roll revision exercise has led to significant deletions, particularly in urban districts where migrants held duplicate cards. Data suggests the number of electors decreased between the draft and final rolls in most analyzed states.

articles.headline: Kejriwal targets Modi and Shah at Delhi Jantar Mantar rally
articles.summary: AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal accused the Prime Minister and Home Minister of conspiring to lodge fake cases against him. The rally was held two days after a court cleared him in an excise policy-related matter.

articles.headline: Siddaramaiah condemns Khamenei killing and US double standards on peace
articles.summary: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah criticized the US military action against Iran, calling the killing of Ali Khamenei unnecessary. He also directed state officials to assist the roughly 150 Kannadigas currently stranded in Dubai and neighboring regions.

articles.headline: Congress made Puducherry an ATM for one family says Modi
articles.summary: Prime Minister Modi alleged that past Congress rule in Puducherry was marked by corruption and served the interests of a single family in Delhi. He urged voters to support the NDA to transform the UT into a medical tourism hub by 2047.

articles.headline: Kerala Chief Minister seeks PM's help for expatriates in West Asia
articles.summary: Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to PM Modi requesting urgent measures to ensure the safety of over 3.5 million Keralites living in the Gulf. The state has opened dedicated helplines as residents report hearing explosions and facing mass flight cancellations.

articles.headline: PM Modi highlights CAA benefits for persecuted Sikhs at martyrdom event
articles.summary: Addressing the 350th martyrdom anniversary of Guru Tegh Bahadur, PM Modi stated that the government ensured justice for the Sikh community through the CAA. He noted that the act provided relief to those facing religious persecution in Afghanistan.

articles.headline: Mamata Banerjee to protest against electoral roll deletions in Bengal
articles.summary: The West Bengal CM will hold a 24-hour protest on March 6 against the removal of 6.18 million names from the state's voter list. The TMC alleges the Election Commission is working under BJP instructions to influence the upcoming polls.

articles.headline: PM Modi discusses regional security with leaders of Israel and UAE
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held telephone conversations with UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu. Modi condemned the missile attacks and discussed the safety of Indian nationals residing in the Gulf region.

articles.headline: CM Siddaramaiah criticizes US attack on Iran as unnecessary and provocative
articles.summary: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah stated that the US-led attack on Iran and the killing of its leader was unnecessary. He criticized the US for engaging in war while preaching peace, noting the loss of innocent lives in the conflict.

articles.headline: Karnataka to proceed with recruitment under fifty percent reservation cap
articles.summary: The state government has directed departments to start hiring for over 56,000 vacancies while adhering to the 50% reservation limit. This decision effectively pauses the previous government's hike in SC and ST quotas pending a final court order.

articles.headline: Bagalkot police cover mosque with cloth ahead of Hindu convention procession
articles.summary: Authorities in Bagalkot covered the Pankha mosque with a curtain as a precautionary measure during a grand Hindu convention. Large numbers of police personnel were deployed to maintain communal harmony and prevent untoward incidents during the march.

articles.headline: Jaishankar discusses safety of ten million Indians with Gulf country ministers
articles.summary: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar contacted counterparts in all GCC nations to share concerns over the security situation in the Gulf. The discussions focused on the well-being of the nearly 10 million Indians living in the region amid escalating strikes.

articles.headline: Massive protests erupt in Kashmir and Uttar Pradesh over Khamenei killing
articles.summary: Thousands of protesters gathered at Srinagar's Lal Chowk and various UP cities to condemn the US-Israeli strike on Iran's leader. J&K authorities shut down educational institutions for two days as a precaution following the widespread demonstrations.

articles.headline: Priyanka Gandhi slams targeted assassination of Iranian leadership as despicable act
articles.summary: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra condemned the killing of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, calling it a betrayal of democratic values. She criticized the Indian government's silence on the matter and called for international peace instead of escalating wars.

articles.headline: Arvind Kejriwal attacks PM Modi over corruption and paper leak issues
articles.summary: Following his legal acquittal, Arvind Kejriwal challenged PM Modi on issues of unemployment, infrastructure decline, and exam paper leaks. Kejriwal alleged that the BJP government has failed in sectors like railways, health, and education over the last 12 years.

articles.headline: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta calls Arvind Kejriwal guilty in public opinion
articles.summary: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta asserted that Kejriwal remains guilty in the eyes of the people despite his recent court acquittal. She emphasized that he must still answer for alleged scams involving the Delhi Jal Board and government school classrooms.

articles.headline: Fifteen Maoists including state committee member surrender with weapons in Chhattisgarh
articles.summary: A group of 15 Maoists carrying a collective bounty of Rs 73 lakh surrendered to police in Mahasamund. The group included a senior leader with an AK-47, effectively collapsing the western sub-zonal structure along the Odisha border.

articles.headline: Stalin defends Tamil Nadu government stand on temple traditions
articles.summary: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin justified the state's position on the Thirupparankundram deepam row, citing the need to safeguard hill temple traditions. He emphasized that personal faith should not be compromised for political purposes.

articles.headline: President to launch pink card for free women bus travel
articles.summary: President Droupadi Murmu will formally launch Delhi's 'Pink National Common Mobility Card' for free bus travel for women. The event will also see the rollout of a scheme providing two free LPG cylinders annually to ration card holders.

articles.headline: Sisodia rallies AAP cadre to make Kejriwal Prime Minister
articles.summary: Senior AAP leader Manish Sisodia urged supporters to work towards installing Arvind Kejriwal as PM while criticizing the central government. Sisodia questioned the current administration's record on development and national security.

articles.headline: BJP launches West Bengal Assembly poll campaign with yatras
articles.summary: The BJP began its 'Parivartan Yatras' from four corners of West Bengal, focusing on issues like infiltration and crimes against women. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to address a concluding rally at Kolkata's Brigade Parade Grounds.

articles.headline: DMK offer of 25 seats unacceptable to Congress leaders
articles.summary: The Congress seat-sharing committee in Tamil Nadu expressed dissatisfaction with the DMK's offer of 25 seats for the upcoming polls. Party leadership indicated that they expect a higher quota given past compromises made for the alliance.

articles.headline: CPI(M) candidate talks enter final stage in Kannur, Kerala
articles.summary: The CPI(M) district secretariat has ramped up preparations for the Kerala Assembly elections, reaching an understanding on candidates for eight seats. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan is expected to seek a third term from Dharmadam.

articles.headline: Data Point: U.P. receives bulk of out-of-State MPLADS funding
articles.summary: An analysis of MPLADS data shows that 84% of funds spent outside an MP's home state were directed to Uttar Pradesh. Only 21 MPs accounted for the nearly ₹18 crore spent on these distant local area projects.

articles.headline: Home Ministry warns states of possible violence and protests
articles.summary: The Centre has cautioned state police departments to increase surveillance around U.S., Israeli, and Iranian diplomatic missions. The advisory flags the risk of sporadic violence following the joint military operations in Tehran.

articles.headline: Congress condemns Khamenei assassination, slams Centre's foreign policy
articles.summary: Mallikarjun Kharge described the targeted killing of the Iranian leader as a signal of the revival of regime-change doctrines. The party alleged the Modi government's response betrays India's long-standing values and interests.

articles.headline: Thousands of Indians stranded as Gulf flight hubs close
articles.summary: Massive flight cancellations were reported across India after major aviation hubs in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, and Doha were targeted by Iranian strikes. The closure of these corridors has severed critical travel routes between Asia, Europe, and North America.

articles.headline: Explosion at Nagpur explosives unit kills 19 workers
articles.summary: A powerful blast at a unit of Solar Energy Limited in Nagpur district resulted in 19 deaths, including several women. Many of the bodies were burnt beyond recognition, and DNA samples are being used for identification.

articles.headline: MCD advises residents to download updated birth certificates
articles.summary: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi has urged residents to check and download updated birth certificates from its unified portal. The move aims to weed out duplicate registration numbers following the unification of the city's three municipal bodies.

articles.headline: Girl dies after falling through broken school bus floor in UP
articles.summary: A seven-year-old student in Aligarh was crushed to death after slipping through a decayed floorboard in her school bus. Authorities have suspended two regional transport officials for negligence as the vehicle was operating without a fitness certificate.

articles.headline: Newlyweds killed as car rams into parked truck in Haveri
articles.summary: A couple married for just 15 days died on the spot when their car crashed into a stationary lorry on NH48. Two other passengers sustained serious injuries and are being treated at a hospital in Hubballi.

articles.headline: Andhra firecracker unit explosion death toll rises to 21
articles.summary: One more victim succumbed to injuries following a massive blast at a licensed cracker unit in Kakinada district. The state government has suspended four officials for dereliction of duty and announced ₹20 lakh compensation for the victims' families.

articles.headline: Indian national among 58 injured in Iranian strikes on UAE
articles.summary: The Indian Embassy confirmed that one Indian citizen was injured during missile and drone attacks on the UAE. Three other foreign nationals from Bangladesh, Nepal, and Pakistan were killed in the same wave of strikes.

articles.headline: Fifteen Maoist cadres surrender to police in Chhattisgarh
articles.summary: A senior divisional committee member and 14 others surrendered in Raipur, citing disappointment with the Maoist ideology. Officials described this as the complete dismantling of the BEM division in the state.

articles.headline: Protests erupt across India over killing of Ayatollah Khamenei
articles.summary: Demonstrators took to the streets in Kashmir, Lucknow, and other parts of India to mourn the death of the Iranian leader. Several Muslim organizations have declared a multiple-day mourning period following the US-Israel military action.

articles.headline: Karnataka government seeks MEA help to evacuate citizens stranded in Gulf
articles.summary: Several Karnataka legislators and hundreds of tourists are stuck in Dubai and Bahrain due to suspended flight operations. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has directed the chief secretary to coordinate with the Ministry of External Affairs for their safe return.

articles.headline: Fifty Bengaluru pilgrims stranded in Medina as West Asia tensions disrupt travel
articles.summary: A group of 50 pilgrims, including women and children, are stuck in Saudi Arabia after their return flights to India were cancelled. Families reported that their savings are running out due to high accommodation and food costs in Medina.

articles.headline: Newlywed couple killed in road accident on Haveri national highway
articles.summary: A couple married on February 13 died after their car rammed into a parked truck in Haveri district. The victims were returning from Navalgund when the fatal crash occurred around 5:00 AM on National Highway-48.

articles.headline: Fire at Bengaluru mattress manufacturing unit injures two and damages apartments
articles.summary: An accidental fire at Grace Traders in Gollahalli village left a firefighter and a driver injured. The blaze caused extensive damage to the unit and shattered windows in the adjacent Platinum Gardenia apartment complex.

articles.headline: Karnataka government allots thirty-six acres of land to Dalit and OBC mutts
articles.summary: The state cabinet approved the allotment of over 36 acres of land to 22 religious institutions representing marginalized communities in Bengaluru North. The land is intended for the development of schools, hospitals, and welfare centers at subsidized rates.

articles.headline: Police sub inspector dies of cardiac arrest during five kilometer run
articles.summary: A 58-year-old sub-inspector, Nasir Hussain, collapsed and died while participating in the 'Karnataka Police Run' in Udupi. The event was intended to promote physical fitness and a drug-free state when the tragedy occurred.

articles.headline: Chennai police detain two hundred protesters marching towards US Consulate
articles.summary: Members of the Tamil Nadu Shia Muslim Jamath were detained while attempting to lay siege to the US Consulate in Chennai. Protesters demanded an end to attacks on Iran following the killing of the Supreme Leader.

articles.headline: Water break saves worker from massive firecracker factory blast in Andhra
articles.summary: A 30-year-old worker narrowly escaped death in a Vetlapalem firecracker unit explosion that killed 21 people. Chappala Samuel survived because he stood up to drink water just moments before the high-intensity blast leveled the building.

articles.headline: Two CRPF personnel injured in Maoist IED blast and firing encounter
articles.summary: An assistant commandant and a jawan were injured during a combing operation in Jharkhand's Saranda forest. The personnel were struck by an IED blast followed by gunfire from Maoists and have been airlifted to New Delhi for treatment.

articles.headline: Several Indians injured in Iranian missile strikes in Gulf
articles.summary: Authorities in the UAE and Oman reported that several Indian citizens were among those injured during Iranian drone and missile attacks. Indian diplomatic missions have heightened activities to assist stranded citizens across the region.

articles.headline: At least 18 killed in Nagpur ammunition factory explosion
articles.summary: A massive blast at SBL Energy Limited in Nagpur district killed at least 18 people and injured over 20 others. The state government and PMO have announced financial compensation for the families of the deceased.

articles.headline: Assam pushes back 21 illegal Bangladeshi migrants including children
articles.summary: Authorities in Sribhumi district sent back 21 illegal migrants to Bangladesh during a midnight operation. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma shared details of the pushback as part of ongoing border security efforts.

articles.headline: Fifteen Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh with cache of weapons
articles.summary: A group of 15 Maoists carrying a bounty of ₹73 lakh surrendered in Mahasamund, marking a significant blow to the BBM division. The group deposited AK-47 rifles and other firearms as part of the state's rehabilitation policy.

articles.headline: Former top Maoist leader visits native Telangana hometown
articles.summary: Mallojula Venugopal Rao, who spent 44 years underground, returned to Peddapalli after surrendering to Maharashtra police. He visited relatives under heavy security, marking a rare public appearance for the former strategist.

articles.headline: Protests erupt in Kashmir and Ladakh over Khamenei's death
articles.summary: Thousands of residents in Srinagar, Kargil, and Leh held demonstrations condemning the killing of the Iranian Supreme Leader. The J&K government ordered a two-day closure of schools and intensified security patrols across the valley.

articles.headline: Zimbabwe cricket team awaits travel clarity amid West Asia tensions
articles.summary: The Zimbabwe T20 World Cup squad is stranded in India following the closure of Dubai's airspace due to escalating conflict. Team batch departures scheduled for Monday have been put on hold as connecting flight routes are currently unavailable.

articles.headline: PSG wins 2025 Champions League ending 55-year wait
articles.summary: Luis Enrique's Paris Saint-Germain defeated Inter Milan 5-0 to secure their first-ever European club title. This victory marked the longest gap between a club's first appearance and their first title in the competition's history.

articles.headline: Poor tactics and middle order collapse lead to Pakistan early World Cup exit
articles.summary: Pakistan's T20 World Cup campaign ended before the semifinals following strategic errors and inconsistent performances by senior batters. Captain Salman Ali Agha acknowledged that the team's decision-making under pressure was inadequate during crucial matches.

articles.headline: South Africa defeats Zimbabwe to enter T20 World Cup semifinals unbeaten
articles.summary: South Africa secured their seventh consecutive victory in the tournament with a five-wicket win over Zimbabwe. Despite a brilliant 73 from Sikandar Raza, Zimbabwe's total of 153 was not enough to stop the Proteas from topping their group.

articles.headline: BCCI engages Zaheer Khan to train next generation of Indian fast bowlers
articles.summary: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan will lead specialized training camps at the Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru. The initiative aims to address the thin pool of fast-bowling resources available for India's red-ball and white-ball formats.

articles.headline: Indian national basketball team stranded in Qatar after Gulf airspace closure
articles.summary: The Indian men's basketball team is unable to leave Doha for their World Cup qualifiers following the suspension of flights in the region. Their scheduled game against Lebanon has been postponed as multiple national teams remain stuck across the Gulf.

articles.headline: PV Sindhu stranded in Dubai and may miss All England Open tournament
articles.summary: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu is stuck at Dubai International Airport due to the ongoing military conflict and flight cancellations. The delay may prevent her from reaching Birmingham in time for the Super-1000 tournament starting Tuesday.

articles.headline: Coach Sjoerd Marijne includes fresh talent in India women hockey qualifiers squad
articles.summary: India's women's hockey coach has named youngsters Annu and Ishika in the squad for the upcoming World Cup qualifiers in Hyderabad. The team features several players from the junior ranks as Marijne focuses on performance-based selection.

articles.headline: Manchester United climb to third in Premier League with win over Palace
articles.summary: Benjamin Sesko scored the winning goal as Manchester United defeated Crystal Palace 2-1. The victory keeps United unbeaten under manager Michael Carrick and moves them closer to a Champions League qualifying spot.

articles.headline: Dean Mascarenhas and Gagan Karumbaiah win final round of Indian National Rally
articles.summary: National champions Dean Mascarenhas and co-driver Gagan Karumbaiah secured a comfortable victory in the final round of the INRC in Nashik. The duo finished a dominant season that saw them clinch the overall title with one round to spare.

articles.headline: World champion Gukesh draws against David Navara in Prague Chess Festival
articles.summary: Grandmaster D Gukesh's search for a win continued as he was held to a draw in the fourth round of the Prague International. Meanwhile, Jorden van Foreest of Holland took the lead in the tournament with his third victory.

articles.headline: Student barred from exam over unpaid fees in Ranebennur
articles.summary: A Class 12 student was initially denied entry to her board examination due to ₹30,000 in unpaid college fees. She was eventually allowed to write the paper after an official intervened and college authorities confiscated her relative's bike keys.

articles.headline: Over 50 percent of sanctioned posts lie vacant at NCERT
articles.summary: Official data reveals that 1,625 out of 2,844 sanctioned positions at NCERT are unfilled, leading to a heavy reliance on contractual staff. Academics warn that this staffing shortfall affects curriculum planning and the quality of textbook development.

articles.headline: L&T skill training hub empowers tribal communities in Odisha
articles.summary: L&T’s residential skill center in Pahadpur has trained over 1,600 local youth in construction and data entry trades. The project focuses on tribal inclusion and women's representation in the workforce, with high placement rates in formal employment.

articles.headline: IIMs adopt AI assisted question paper setting to reduce faculty workload
articles.summary: IIM Nagpur and IIM Kozhikode are exploring the use of AI to generate academic assessments and question papers. While the move ensures speed and scalability, faculty warn of the risk of rewarding shallow answers and the need for human curation.

articles.headline: Candidates flag discrepancies in final UGC NET December 2025 answer key
articles.summary: Aspirants have taken legal action against the NTA over alleged errors in the final answer key for several subjects. Candidates claim that incorrect answers persisted despite paying fees to challenge the provisional key, affecting JRF eligibility for many.

articles.headline: Indian educators urge balanced regulation over blanket social media ban for children
articles.summary: Following Australia's ban on social media for under-16s, Indian educators are advocating for mindful usage and structured regulation. Experts warn that platforms are designed to be addictive, but total prohibition may not be practical in a digital era.

articles.headline: Students decry curbs on dissent across Delhi university campuses
articles.summary: Student unions at JNU and DU have protested against increasing proctorial inquiries, rustications, and protest bans. Activists claim university administrations are using administrative processes to suppress anti-caste mobilizations.

articles.headline: Shia Muslims across India protest against killing of Ayatollah Khamenei
articles.summary: Thousands of protesters took to the streets in Srinagar, Lucknow, and Hyderabad to mourn the death of Iran's Supreme Leader. Demonstrators raised slogans against the US and Israel, while several local leaders announced three days of mourning.

articles.headline: Shia Muslims in Bengaluru hold solidarity march for Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
articles.summary: Hundreds of protesters gathered in Bengaluru's Richmond Town to condemn the killing of Iran's Supreme Leader in US-Israel strikes. Participants held photographs of Khamenei and raised slogans against the US and Israel during the condolence meeting.

articles.headline: Shia-majority Alipur village in Karnataka observes mourning for Iranian leader
articles.summary: Residents of Alipur village in Chikkaballapur announced a three-day mourning period following the death of Ayatollah Ali Khamenei. Shops remained shut and special prayers were held for the leader, who had visited the village four decades ago.

articles.headline: February GST revenue grows 8.1 percent to 1.84 lakh crore
articles.summary: Gross GST collections rose 8.1% year-on-year to ₹1.84 lakh crore in February, marking the third consecutive month of growth under the revamped GST 2.0 regime. This performance was driven by resilient domestic consumption following September's tax rate cuts and a surge in imports. The figures reflect a robust economic performance despite the rationalization of compensation cesses.

articles.headline: Airlines cancel 350 flights as West Asia conflict escalates
articles.summary: Indian carriers cancelled nearly 350 flights on Sunday following air strikes and the closure of airspace in the UAE, Bahrain, Kuwait, and Qatar. Services to 11 countries remain suspended, forcing airlines like Air India to scrap or reroute long-haul routes to Europe and the U.S. Outbound flights are currently being diverted to avoid the West Asian region as the conflict continues.

articles.headline: Kerala CM inaugurates new township for Wayanad landslide survivors in Kalpetta
articles.summary: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurated the first phase of a new township in Kalpetta, handing over keys to 178 houses for families displaced by the 2024 Mundakkai-Chooralmala landslides. The project restores permanent addresses to survivors who had been living in rented accommodations for nearly 19 months. Additionally, the Kerala government pledged to assume nearly ₹19 crore in loan arrears for the affected victims.

articles.headline: Sanju Samson's unbeaten 97 powers India into T20 World Cup semifinals
articles.summary: Sanju Samson's career-best unbeaten 97 anchored a chase of 196 to lead India to a five-wicket victory over the West Indies at Eden Gardens. This win secured India's record-equalling sixth T20 World Cup semifinal appearance. The team is now scheduled to face England in the last-four clash at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.

articles.headline: Alyssa Healy retires from ODI cricket with massive century against India
articles.summary: Australian captain Alyssa Healy signed off from ODI cricket with a commanding 158 off 98 balls, leading her team to a 148-run victory and a 3-0 series whitewash against India in Hobart. The record-breaking innings concluded an illustrious 126-match career in the format, during which she amassed 3,777 runs and eight centuries. This final performance helped Australia secure a dominant series sweep.

articles.headline: Jammu & Kashmir wins maiden Ranji Trophy title against Karnataka
articles.summary: Jammu & Kashmir made history by defeating powerhouse Karnataka in the final at Hubballi to claim their first-ever Ranji Trophy championship. Pace bowler Auqib Nabi led the historic triumph, finishing the season with a record 60 wickets. While Karnataka saw multiple double centuries during the season, their bowling attack failed to apply pressure in the decisive title match.

articles.headline: CBSE postpones board exams in West Asian countries due to conflict
articles.summary: The CBSE has deferred Class 10 and 12 examinations scheduled for early March across several West Asian countries, including Kuwait, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, Bahrain, and Iran. This decision affects more than 150 affiliated schools and was necessitated by escalating regional tensions and widespread airspace closures. The board cited travel disruptions and the current security situation as the primary reasons for the postponement.
